latestAction.text: Cloture on the motion to proceed not invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 48. Record Vote Number: 227. (consideration: CR S8398; text: CR S8398)

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 230 - 195 (Roll no. 113). (text: CR H2043)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 230 - 195 (Roll no. 113).(text: CR H2043)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 228 - 197 (Roll no. 112). (consideration: CR H2053-2054)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 203.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H2043-2054)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 18.

All points of order against consideration of the bill are waived except those arising under clause 9 or 10 of rule XXI. It shall be in order to consider as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five-minute rule the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Education and Labor now printed in the bill. Each such amendment may be offered only in the order printed in the report, may be offered only by a Member designated in the report, shall be considered as read, shall be debatable for the time specificed in the report equally divided and controlled by the proponent and opponent, shall not be subject to a demand for a division of the question
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-26, by Ms. Sutton.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-26, by Ms. Sutton.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 800) to amend the National Labor Relations Act to establish an efficient system to enable employees to form, join, or assist labor organizations, to provide for mandatory injunctions for unfair labor practices during organizing efforts.
Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 800 (Employee Free Choice Act).
Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 800 (Employee Free Choice Act).

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
